title: Chang Hyuk-jin
text:
Chang Hyuk-jin (; born 6 December 1989) is a South Korean <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> <a href="Midfielder%20%28football%29">midfielder</a> who plays for the <a href="K%20League%202">K League 2</a> side <a href="Gyeongnam%20FC">Gyeongnam FC</a>.
Club career.
Chang joined <a href="Gangwon%20FC">Gangwon FC</a> for the 2011 K League season, having previously turned out for <a href="Korea%20National%20League">National League</a> side <a href="Gangneung%20City%20FC">Gangneung City FC</a>. His first match for Gangwon was the second group match of the <a href="2011%20K-League%20Cup">2011 K-League Cup</a> against the <a href="Chunnam%20Dragons">Chunnam Dragons</a>, in which he came on as a substitute midway through the second half. Chang's first match in the K-League itself was against <a href="Ulsan%20Hyundai%20FC">Ulsan Hyundai FC</a>, again as a substitute.
